newsitem.title: USA: Mechanical Dynamics sees Q4 below consensus.
newsitem.headline: Mechanical Dynamics sees Q4 below consensus.

text.p: Mechanical Dynamics Inc, a supplier of software and services for the virtual prototyping market, said on Tuesday its fourth-quarter revenue rose by about 10 percent from a year ago but both revenue and earnings fell short of investment analysts' estimates.

The company said street expectations were for quarterly earnings of $0.16 per share on revenues in a range of $7.4 million to $7.6 million. A year ago, the company earned $0.10 a share in the quarter on revenues of $6.0 million.
President Michael Korybalski attributed the company's disappointing fourth-quarter performance primarily to lower-than-expected revenue from the Asia/Pacific region.
"Another contributing factor was the strength of the U.S. dollar versus the Japanese yen and German mark," he said in a statement.

Korybalski added, "While we had expected better performance in the fourth quarter, we remain extremely positive about our immediate and long-term growth prospects. Demand for our ADAMS virtual prototyping software remains strong worldwide, and we're seeing increasing acceptance of the new products we're bringing to market, especially our ADAMS/Car specialized vehicle simulation software."
Mechanical Dynamics will report results for the quarter and year ended December 31 later this month.
